intro: Silene pumilio, commonly known as the alpine campion, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapting to cold and windy environments. Silene pumilio thrives in rocky soils and is often found in mountainous habitats.
